data.meta_description: YUNIKA VISION,Experience the high performance of Japan's largest 3-panelled high-vision LED displays.
data.text:
YUNIKA VISION can provide advance notices of commercial broadcasts.

Our exclusive plan for record labels also includes advance notices posted via YUNIKA VISION's official Twitter and Facebook accounts which provides information on broadcast content, broadcast period and time schedule over multiple posts.

(Please contact us for further details on SNS interlinked commercial broadcasts.)

Across from YUNIKA VISION is the PePe Plaza in front of the Seibu-Shinjuku Station. This plaza area is utilized for events interlinked with commercial broadcasts. Diverse plans are possible for events, such as distributing sample goods, exhibition & spot sales, and live performances by artists.

(A separate fee is required for the use of the PePe Plaza in front of the Seibu-Shinjuku Station. Please contact us for further details.)

In recent years, the digital signage market is gaining prominence within the advertisement industry. Within this ever-growing market, YUNIKA VISION includes the best conditions to generate the highest advertising effectiveness.

Its location is in Shinjuku, with the busiest train station and largest number of visitors in Japan. At Shinjuku Station's east exit, a multitude of people gather for various purposes, such as to shop, to eat, to sightsee, or to work. A vibrant commercial district lines along Yasukuni-dori and various JR lines travel across the O-guard railroad bridge. Facing these bustling thoroughfares, YUNIKA VISION naturally becomes a visual focal point for every passerby.

Because such diverse people gather in Shinjuku, broadcast content can be customized to the needs of our clients for maximum effect. For example, broadcast time can be focused on commuting hours targeting workers, or limited to the weekends and holidays targeting tourists.

Also, the high quality sound only made possible by YUNIKA VISION can be utilized to attract the attention of passersby, while the 3-panelled large-scale LED display can deliver more information, more advertising appeal to enable a highly effective advertisement.

Furthermore, by presenting locality-based visual content with higher entertainment properties or useful daily information such as weather forecasts, broadcasts can continually attract the attention of passersby. Through designing such eye-catching content, we aim to increase the advertising effectiveness of our clients.

Even within Tokyo's advanced transportation system including JR Lines and other private railroads, Shinjuku Station handles the most passengers in the city. It was recognized in 2007 by the Guinness World Records as the busiest station in the world with the most passengers passing through.

YUNIKA VISION content can also be viewed from the several JR Lines passing across the O-guard railroad bridge.

The traffic flow considered is wide-ranging, covering not only Shinjuku Station but also the Seibu-Shinjuku Station in front and Shinjuku 3-chome areas. The wide visual range of YUNIKA VISION makes it possible to deliver visual content to that many more people.

Additidinal information on train passenger circulation

Shinjuku Station has the highest number of train passengers in Japan. It is a main hub for numerous train lines, with Japan Rail (JR) lines alone comprising the Yamanote, Chuo Main, Chuo, Sobu, Saikyo, Shonan Shinjuku, and Narita Express lines. Yunika Vision is clearly visible from inside the trains of these lines from the O-guard rail overpass. Furthermore, Yunika Vision is in a location that guarantees it will be seen from various busy spots, including the Seibu Shinjuku Station and the exits of Shinjuku San-chome Station.
